title: Delhi on the Back Burner as One Heads for the Quaint Getaways
text:
Delhi on the Back Burner as One Heads for the Quaint Getaways Delhi on the Back Burner as One Heads for the Quaint Getaways 0 
You must have heard that famous phrase; "All work but no play, makes Jack a dull boy." Let us add "make Jill a dull girl," as well so as to not forget anybody. The question is, do you identify with this quote. Look at yourself in the mirror. You have reduced yourself to a machine that works round the clock. So stop! For you own sake, take a short trip over the weekend and just relax. 
If it helps, go through our list of weekend getaways from Delhi and choose a place from there. 
Of nine corners and a lake- 
Uttarakhand is blessed with yet another beautiful location. This time it is Naukuchiatal, a place made famous by a lake that supposedly has nine corners. Legend has it that if one manages to get a glimpse of all these nine corners at a single go, then one is given the gift of Nirvana. The lake is 175 feet deep and is a great place to go boating. This place is around 299 kilometres away from the city and will take one about five and a half hour to reach. Once there, do not hold back. Go on one the treks that this place has to offer or simply take the route to relaxation. You deserve this visit so do not hesitate. Take your family along so that all of you can get the time to bond together in the lap of nature. If you are the curious type, try the nine corners of the lake myth and be satisfied that we add this place to our list of weekend getaways from Delhi. 
Romance at Nahan- 
Six hours away from New Delhi is a place called Nahan that lies amidst the Shiwalik range. The place serves as a great getaway for those who need a holiday from the monotony of office life and also for those who seek a romantic weekend in solitude. The place is surrounded by hill ranges and a lake that provides much recreation and relaxation 
The Queens own farm- 
Ranikhet is a superb option for those who wish to get away from the chaotic crowds of the city of Delhi and enjoy some of the best of what nature has to offer man. Transliterated as 'Queens Farm,' this place was indeed developed by the English when they ruled the country. The presence of dense jungle makes for a great trekking adventure while the Jhula Devi temple is a must visit. The reason why this place is referred to as the 'Queens Farm,' is because of the many orchards found here. The Chaubatia Orchards is famed for its luscious plums, apricots, apples and peaches and is a great take away from this place. Just 350 kilometres away from Delhi, this place is a great spot to be at. 
Rivers meet at the famous Devprayag- 
The Alakananda and Bhagirathi rivers meet at a point which is called Devprayag - a land that lies 318 kilometres away from Delhi. The place is famous because of its temples - Raghunathji and Chandrabadani that attract people by the droves. When it comes to trekking, the terrain of the Daharathachal peak offers one a few good options. It would be to your advantage if you visited this place. Saurav Mishra has written this article that deals with a few spots that one can visit during the weekend to escape the noise and pollution of Delhi. He also suggests weekend getaways from Delhi that you could use to refresh your mind. Rate this Article
